Undid revision 451420929. Christ "may" return at any moment. He is not continuously returning every moment of time as is implied by the word "will".
/* Background */ There is no reason to point out one specific movement that has been identified with Pentecostal beliefs.

/* Beliefs and practices */ Added another image
/* Independent groups */ Removed some comments that are polemic in nature and don't seem to fit well with the article in question.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/173.60.55.116|173.60.55.116]] ([[User talk:173.60.55.116|talk]]) to last revision by Ltwin ([[WP:HG|HG]])
/* Baptism with the Holy Spirit */ Shortening this quote which requires more context for the full quote to be properly understood.
/* Word of wisdom and word of knowledge */ sp
/* Characteristics */ Added section on interracial origins.
/* Worship */ This heading is no longer needed.
/* Parham and Seymour */ Trying to summarize
/* Early controversies */ Adding the beginning of the Oneness Pentecostals
/* Early controversies */ Added formation of the Assemblies of God
/* Early controversies */ Expanded finished work controversy
/* Spread */Adding paragraph explaining early anti-Pentecostal criticism
/* Oneness Pentecostalism */ Removing statement marked with "citation needed" since August 2010.
/* Early revivals: 1900–1920 */ extended period of time covered by section
/* Early revivals: 1900–1920 */ Added Paul and Pethrus
/* Early revivals: 1900–1920 */ Adding Durham's work in Canada
/* Early revivals: 1900–1920 */ Added T. B. Barratt's contribution
/* Early revivals: 1900–1920 */ Tracing the spread of Azusa St.
/* Early revivals: 1900–1920 */ Improved the description of the Azusa Street Revival
Revert: It is not encyclopedic to capitalize pronouns referencing deity.

Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/2.126.218.230|2.126.218.230]] to version by Ltwin. False positive? [[User:ClueBot NG/FalsePositives|Report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot NG|ClueBot NG]]. (508704) (Bot)
/* Ordinances */ Separating Holy Communion and foot washing into separate paragraphs. Removing the word "some" in several places as there is nearly universal conformity on the issue of wine, etc.
/* Beliefs and practices */ This is covered in a section below.
Adding [[Apostolic Age]] in introduction. Removed "worship styles" as this gives the impression that they think they worship in the same exact manner as the Apostles did, which is not the case.
/* Beliefs and practices */ link to books
/* Divine healing */ Revised and expanded section.
The sentence removed was referring to the diversity of Pentecostal denominations and the fact that no one organization represents the entire movement.

i made the correction that within the pentecostal faith, nontrinitarian and apostolic is the same thing, and there are organizations and governments that do directly relate to the pentecostal movement, all with their own doctrine
/* Word of wisdom and word of knowledge */ Much of this repeats information already presented in the main articles.
/* Spiritual gifts */ Re-wrote last sentence of the overview on spiritual gifts
/* Beliefs and practices */ Moving some things around
/* Spiritual gifts */ Adding section on power gifts

/* Vocal gifts */ Rewritten the section on prophecy.
/* Spiritual gifts */ Adding introductory section for "Vocal gifts"

A more broad definition of Pentecostalism
/* Characteristics */ added paragraph originally in the beliefs section

/* Baptism with the Holy Spirit */ sp
/* Spirit baptism */ I've re-written and expanded this section. Much of the original material remains.

UPCI is a denomination, not a fellowship org.
No they are not known for this. Someone thinks they are funny.
/* Salvation */ Added that regeneration, justification, adoption, and sanctification are included in salvation.
/* Salvation */ Revision and more thorough sourcing of this section.
/* Beliefs and practices */ More precise and accurate language.
WP:ENDASH, replaced: post-World War → post–World War (2) using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
"they can't wear jeans": This is totally wrong. Only a small minority of Pentecostals believe that women can't wear jeans.
Is there a reason for deleting this image?
We've been through this before. Check cited sources and the talk page discussions.
Undid revision 414598626 by [[Special:Contributions/Heartloving|Heartloving]] ([[User talk:Heartloving|talk]]). Restored sourced content.
removed "is the only religion that will get you to heaven" for obvious reasons
/* Salvation */ Clarifying - it is not only the work on the cross but the resurrection also.
/* Speaking in tongues */ This needs more context, without it it is just confusing to the uninformed reader.

Reverting section blanking and removing of sourced information.

No need to use the archaic. While some Pentecostals use King James English only, many other Pentecostals use modern English.

It's not distinctive in the sense that tongues are found in other religions, but it is distinctive in the sense that tongues is one of the things that distinguishes Pent. from other types of Christian

[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Ltwin|Ltwin]] ([[User talk:Ltwin|talk]]) to last version by Topsaint
/* Salvation */ Emphasizing that all believers should seek Spirit baptism is not the same thing as saying that it is required. Indwelling is distinguished from infilling in the article.
You are missing the context and understanding of the article. The references are there to say otherwise. Further in the article, non-speaking in tongues is covered.
Most DO NOT believe this is necessary for salvation.
Reverted to revision 386199151 by [[Special:Contributions/Ltwin|Ltwin]]; source says otherwise. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ There are some Pentecostals who would disagree, Oneness in particular.
There are more Pentecostals out there than just Oneness. Try not to be so theologically arrogant and ill informed when contributing to an encyclopedia. Thank you.

Rearranged sentences in a lead paragraph.
There needed to be greater emphasis placed on these miracles, gifts, and spiritual connectedness with God are readily available for people today! I added the scripture, Acts 2:38.

Undid revision 378665163 by [[Special:Contributions/Ltwin|Ltwin]] ([[User talk:Ltwin|talk]]). PLEASE REFER TO THE TALK PAGE. DISCUSS THERE.
Undo - when Wikipedia describes every religious movement as a "sect" then this article will do the same. Until then we will call it what it is a "movement".
Pentecostalism falls under the definition of "sect". Please refer to the discussion page.
